title: A Series of Kings and National Decline
summary: Uzziah (Azariah) reigns in Judah and prospers until he is struck with leprosy. In Israel, several kings rule briefly as the kingdom faces instability and assassinations. The Assyrians begin to exert influence, signaling coming judgment.

faq.question: Why did Uzziah become a leper?
faq.answer: Because he unlawfully entered the temple to burn incense.

faq.question: What characterizes Israelâ€™s leadership during this time?
faq.answer: Instability, short reigns, and frequent assassinations.
